title: Preparing Americans for High-Paying Skilled Trade Jobs of the Future

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to review and improve workforce development programs to better prepare American workers for skilled trade jobs, especially in growing industries. It also mandates expanding Registered Apprenticeships, increasing transparency in program outcomes, and integrating new technologies like Artificial Intelligence to upskill workers.
potential_concerns: The emphasis on integrating Artificial Intelligence for upskilling may disadvantage individuals-with-disabilities if adequate accessibility accommodations are not implemented.
Expanding Registered Apprenticeships primarily in high-growth sectors might leave behind workers in declining industries or rural-communities due to geographic or industry mismatch.
The focus on alternative credentials over traditional four-year degrees could create confusion or legitimacy concerns among working-age-adults seeking recognition for their skills.
Streamlining and consolidating programs might unintentionally eliminate some workforce development initiatives that currently serve niche or vulnerable populations effectively.
